messages.message: are you still trying to debug this? if so, do you see any error logs in `core-platform-service`?

```owner@dev:~/instabase/shared-utils/py-utils/system-status-utils$ cs logs -n 10000 core-platform-service
Fatal: failed to find any matched log source.```
it seems to not run

it seems that Nikolaos was using an outdated crafting template called `mfichman-ibdev-docker`

i asked Nikolaos to create a new sandbox using the `ibdev-backend` template, just to make sure he has all the latest fixes from the template that everyone is supposed to use

so we’ll wait to see what happens once the new sandbox is up

now when I am trying to get a new sandbox running I get:
```exec error: exit status 128

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
+ [[ -z '' ]]
+ git fetch origin master
<mailto:git@github.com|git@github.com>: Permission denied (publickey).
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.```
and the key is already in github and instabase is associated (and the other sandbox can git pull just fine)
i think it’s bc github is down :disappointed: https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1736812756799429
